intro: Navarretia hamata var. foliacea, commonly known as the slender navarretia, is a flowering plant native to California and southern Oregon. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant has slender, hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often clustered at the base. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along streambanks. This variety is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology compared to other Navarretia species.
